papers.note: Debye temperature paper - T approaches 480K at high E
Debye temperature paper - T approaches 720K at high E
Debye temperature paper - T approaches 680K at high E
Debye temperature paper - T approaches 750K at high E

datapoints.notes: Flash sintering at 1100°C with 300 V/cm

first_principles_params.note: Partial calibration; some points are steady-state not onset

datapoints.notes: Flash onset at 1100°C with 50 V/cm (constant heating rate). Higher field data (>300 V/cm) involves hot-spot formation - different physics.
Flash onset at 700-750°C (midpoint 725°C) with 50 V/cm

papers.note: Porous silica glass (95% SiO2, 2.3% Na2O, 1.6% Al2O3)

datapoints.notes: Flash sintering at ~600°C with 3000 V/cm

papers.note: High entropy pyrochlore for nuclear waste immobilization
RFS - empirical Ea=0.50 works better than literature Ea=1.5-2.5

datapoints.notes: High T regime
High T regime
High T regime
High T regime
High T regime
High T regime
High T regime
High T regime

papers.notes: Conventional FS. Flash-effective Ea=0.5eV justified by non-equilibrium effects.

papers.technique: Reactive Flash Sintering at Room Temperature
papers.notes: Room temperature flash sintering! Li doping enables superionic conductivity. Ea=0.3eV for Li+ hopping.

datapoints.notes: Near T_min boundary

papers.notes: SOFC cathode material. Ea=0.20eV from first-principles (small polaron hopping). Very conductive - low fields (2-18 V/cm). 3/4 calibrated.
papers.first_principles_note: Ea lowered from 0.25 to 0.20 eV based on high-T small polaron hopping in mixed-valence spinel.

papers.notes: Ferroelectric perovskite. Explicit T-E data from paper. 4/4 calibrated with 0% error. Ea=0.80eV (oxygen vacancy migration).
High entropy TM nitride. Green compact σ₀=100 S/m (particle contacts limit conduction). Ea=0.20eV (grain boundary hopping). Bulk nitride is metallic but green compact is semiconducting.
papers.first_principles_note: Flash Balance applies to green compact state, not dense metallic nitride. Particle-particle contact resistance gives effective σ₀~100 S/m.

datapoints.notes: Current-rate flash: J_crit=20 A/mm² triggers flash at T≈1000°C (0.74 T_M). E_eff calculated from J_crit × ρ_green

papers.notes: Current-rate flash sintering at ambient temperature. E_eff = J_crit × ρ_green. NiO oxide layer dominates green compact resistivity. Ea=0.05eV (metallic with oxide tunneling barriers).
papers.current_rate_workflow: E_effective = J_critical × ρ_green_compact. For Ni: J_crit=20 A/mm², ρ_green~10⁻³ Ω·m → E_eff=200 V/cm

papers.notes: SrTiO3 with Fe doping at constant 140 V/cm. Ea decreases with Fe doping (0.85→0.75 eV). 3/3 calibrated with <1% error. Fe creates oxygen vacancies, lowering onset T.

datapoints.notes: 900°C, first-principles
950°C, first-principles
1000°C, first-principles
1050°C, first-principles

papers.notes: Porcelain stoneware (mullite + glassy matrix). First-principles Ea = 0.84 eV accounts for grain boundary + glass conduction. Perfect calibration 4/4.

papers.filename: Power Density at the Onset of Flash Sintering Raj.pdf

datapoints.notes: 1075°C, first-principles Ea=1.0eV

papers.notes: Al₂O₃-3YSZ (50:50) composite from theoretical paper. Ea same as 3YSZ (percolating YSZ network). Large r_eff=30μm due to composite grain structure.

datapoints.notes: 800°C, first-principles for 8YSZ (fully stabilized cubic)

papers.notes: 8YSZ (8 mol% Y₂O₃) - fully stabilized cubic phase. Lower Ea (0.85 vs 1.0 eV) and higher σ₀ (10000 vs 4000 S/m) vs 3YSZ due to ~2.7× more oxygen vacancies.

datapoints.notes: 900°C, current-rate 1 A/s, J_crit=10 A/mm², first-principles green compact

papers.notes: Rhenium metal flash sintering via current-rate control. Green compact parameters: Ea=0.28eV (tunneling barriers), σ₀=500 S/m. Flash at 0.34 T_m. J_crit=10 A/mm² converted to E_eff=100 V/cm.

datapoints.notes: 850°C, Fe-doped perovskite MIEC, Ea=0.63eV (mixed ionic-electronic)

papers.notes: Fe-doped SrTiO₃ (MIEC). Ea=0.63eV is between pure electronic (0.3-0.5eV) and ionic (1.0eV) due to Fe³⁺/Fe²⁺ polaron hopping + O²⁻ ionic conduction.

datapoints.notes: 1000°C isothermal, SiC percolating network, Ea=0.50eV

papers.notes: SiC whisker reinforced 3YSZ (17.5 vol%). Percolating SiC network reduces Ea from 1.0 to 0.50 eV. Flash at 80 V/cm at 1000°C.

datapoints.notes: 850°C, standard SDC flash (without graphite)

papers.notes: Samarium-doped ceria (SDC) - SOFC electrolyte. Paper also reports graphite-assisted flash at 25°C (different mechanism). Standard flash onset at 850°C/120V/cm.

datapoints.notes: 850°C, reactive flash sintering of hard magnet

papers.notes: Strontium hexaferrite (M-type hard ferrite). Permanent magnet material with Fe³⁺ polaron hopping (Ea=0.37eV). Reactive flash synthesis + densification.

datapoints.notes: 800°C, undoped SrTiO3 flash onset

papers.notes: Undoped SrTiO₃ flash sintering. Paper also studies SrTiO₃-KNbO₃ composites which show flash (conductivity spike) but NO sintering. σ₀ lower than Fe-doped due to no dopant carriers.

datapoints.notes: Room temperature flash at 450 V/cm
Room temperature flash at 500 V/cm

papers.notes: Single crystal rutile TiO2. First principles calibration shows lower σ₀ (100 S/m vs 1200 for polycrystalline) due to fewer defects. Model successfully predicts threshold behavior at 400-450 V/cm boundary.

datapoints.notes: Room temperature flash at 187 V/cm
Flash onset at 125 V/cm
Flash onset at 57 V/cm

papers.notes: UO₂ (Uranium Dioxide) nuclear fuel from Los Alamos National Lab. Studied UO2.00, UO2.08, UO2.16 stoichiometries. Low Ea (0.20 eV) indicates electronic polaron hopping, not ionic O migration. High σ₀ due to hyperstoichiometry creating electron carriers.

datapoints.notes: Current-rate flash (no furnace): J_crit=20 A/mm², T_onset=1000°C (0.30 T_M)

papers.notes: Tungsten metal current-rate flash sintering at room temperature (no furnace). Highest melting point metal (3422°C) sintered in <1 min. J_crit = 7.5 A/mm² converted to E_eff = 75 V/cm via green compact resistivity.

datapoints.notes: 850°C flash at 120 V/cm, binder-less WC

papers.notes: Binder-less tungsten carbide flash sintered in <6 seconds. Parameters represent GREEN COMPACT properties (not dense WC). Ea=0.45eV reflects barrier at WO3 oxide interfaces between particles. σ₀=800 S/m much lower than bulk WC due to contact resistance and porosity.

datapoints.notes: 553-565°C flash onset at 300 V/cm

papers.notes: Pure ZnO flash sintering. Paper also studies 0.5 mol% Bi₂O₃-doped ZnO. Ea=0.30eV indicates electronic polaron hopping dominates at flash temperatures. Wide bandgap semiconductor (Eg=3.37eV) with n-type conductivity from O vacancies.

datapoints.notes: 750°C flash at ~32 V/cm

papers.notes: Zirconium Nitride (ZrN) - metallic conductor similar to TiN. Bulk resistivity ~18 μΩ·cm. Very low field required (32 V/cm) due to high conductivity. Flash Balance applies to green compact properties, not dense material.

datapoints.notes: 1200°C RFS at 250 V/cm

papers.notes: ZrO₂-CeO₂ (80-20 mol%) reactive flash sintering from Los Alamos. CeO₂ enhances ionic conductivity, resulting in lower Ea (0.80 eV) compared to pure ZrO₂. Solid solution forms during RFS process.

datapoints.notes: 2085°C flash at 20 V/cm (very low field)

papers.notes: Alpha-SiC (6H polytype) pressureless flash sintering from Oxford. Requires very low fields (15-40 V/cm) due to high conductivity at elevated temps. Same parameters as database SiC work well, validating model at low-field/high-temp regime.

datapoints.notes: 315°C flash at 230 V/cm (single crystal)

papers.notes: Cubic ZrO₂ SINGLE CRYSTAL flash. No grain boundaries → bulk conduction. Lower Ea (0.50 vs 0.90 eV for polycrystalline) and higher σ₀ (100000 vs ~3000 S/m). Demonstrates Flash Balance Equation extends to single crystals with appropriate parameter adjustments.

datapoints.notes: 1300°C instant flash (10s incubation)

papers.notes: 50 vol% 3YSZ-Al₂O₃ composite. Conductivity dominated by 3YSZ percolation network. Flash Balance valid for high-field conditions where flash is instantaneous.

datapoints.notes: 875°C onset with 5 MPa applied load

papers.notes: 3YSZ flash sinterforging. Applied 5 MPa mechanical stress enhances particle contacts, increasing effective σ₀ by ~20× vs standard flash. Demonstrates Flash Balance extends to pressure-assisted techniques.

datapoints.notes: 850°C flash at 120 V/cm - seminal paper headline result

papers.notes: Seminal flash sintering paper by Cologna, Rashkova & Raj (2010). Demonstrated flash sintering of 3YSZ in <5s at 850°C. Established the field.

datapoints.notes: 900°C flash at 1500 V/cm with Pt electrodes

papers.notes: Flash sintering of alumina. High E-field required (1500 V/cm vs ~100 for 3YSZ) due to insulating nature. Effective Ea (~0.82 eV) much lower than bulk (~3-4 eV), indicating GB-dominated transport.

datapoints.notes: 1260°C flash at 1000 V/cm (brief incubation)

papers.notes: MgO-doped alumina. MgO doping enhances conductivity and lowers required E-field (1000 vs 1500 V/cm for pure Al2O3). Lower effective Ea (0.70 vs 0.82 eV) due to doping.

datapoints.notes: 1100°C flash at 80 V/cm AC (1 kHz)

papers.notes: SnO₂ AC flash sintering (1 kHz). AC fields require ~400°C higher onset than DC due to reduced net Joule heating per cycle. Separate from DC SnO₂ parameters.

datapoints.notes: 900°C flash at 500 V/cm

papers.notes: Undoped SrTiO₃ flash sintering. Paper notes "relatively high resistivity". Higher Ea (0.60 eV) and lower σ₀ (200 S/m) than previously assumed. FAST region (150 V/cm) excluded - not pure flash.

rejected.reason: CONDUCTIVITY_ONLY - no paired T+E flash sintering data
CONDUCTIVITY_ONLY - no temperature values, cannot pair T+E
INSUFFICIENT - no T or E values
CONDUCTIVITY_ONLY - theoretical paper, no T+E pairs
REVIEW - no temperature values, no T+E pairs
No explicit T vs E onset data - paper focuses on phase formation mechanism
Supplementary material for Paper #46 - no new T-E datapoints
Mechanism/theory paper - no explicit T-E onset data tables
